results.deck: Mr Boom's Firework Factory is an unforgiving and difficult puzzle game, made for people who like a challenge. Move the firework crates from the machines to the exits without causing catastrophic explosions.
results.description:
Summary

Mr Boom's Firework Factory is a fast-paced puzzle game for PC, released summer 2019 on PC, for Windows.

It was developed by Brainbox.cc, taking 9 years to go from concept to final release. The game is designed to present a challenge to hardcore gamers, attempting to turn the casual genre on it's head.

Location

The game is set in the titular firework factory, with each level being set in one of many rooms. In each room the layout of the floor differs, however the room's outer shape remains the same. Each room presents a different set of challenges for the player.
results.name: Mr Boom's Firework Factory

results.deck: First part of the second episode in the trilogy
results.description:
Directly following from the events of Welcome To... Chichester 1/Redux, the protagonist is unprepared for the revelation that his holiday destination has been modified by his nemesis, Grendel Jinx, for her own purposes.

Forced to go on a guided tour, unwanted revelations are revealed at the end of the day.
results.name: Welcome To... Chichester 2 - Part 1 : The Spy Of Chichester And The Eager Tourist Guide

results.deck: Welcome To... Chichester 1/Redux : The Spy Of America And The Long Vacation is the first in the Welcome To... Chichester trilogy series of visual novels
results.description:
The Council Of The Unseen - an organisation dedicated to world domination, is all but destroyed by the protagonist, leaving two survivors: The megalomaniacal, kleptomaniac and cake mix loving Grendel Jinx and her much put-upon assistant/receptionist, Katherine.

Initially wanting revenge, her plans change when the protagonist accidentally reveals that he is going on holiday. Plans further change when she finds out where he is going, rekindling memories of a mission she had to abandon a few years prior.

Modifying the protagonists holiday, she plans to use him to finally complete her mission.

Katherine, meanwhile, plans to extract revenge on Grendel, for all the work she has had to do without any help - or pay...
results.name: Welcome To... Chichester 1/Redux : The Spy Of America And The Long Vacation

results.deck: A short side-story of the Welcome To... Chichester series
results.description:
Taking place on the unluckiest day of the year, the protagonist and his friends get an invite to "The Beach". With the protagonist's friends mistaking this for a private beach party, they are sorely disappointed when everyone has to search for three parts of a missing sword.

Events become more complicated when two more characters turn up.
results.name: Welcome To... Chichester OVN : The Beach

results.deck: Forest of Evil: This game is an Indie 2D action platformer inspired by games like the 1990s Castlevania.
results.description: Forest of Evil centers around an assassin from the crusades in the year 1291 as he makes his long journey home now that the warring to which he had been called has come to an end. He decides to take the long path home through unfamiliar lands, but little does he know that he is about to stumble upon a land filled with a deep evil. This game consists of 9 unique levels each with their own boss that can be completed in a somewhat nonlinear fashion as you only need to complete 5 levels to beat the game. This offers some re-playability since you need to take different paths while going through the game to experience each level. This game also has a hard mode which unlocks once you've beaten the game once, and a boss rush mode which unlocks after you've defeated every boss at least once.
results.name: Forest of Evil

results.deck: HereAfter: This game is a 2D action platformer inspired by games like the 1990s Mega-man.
results.description: HereAfter centers around a seemingly abandoned robotic experiment which happens to reboot one day by some unknown means. Instead of finding its creator standing over it however, it wakes to find the scientific facility in which it was created left to ruin and completely over-run by a variety of other experiments that have escaped their containment. In the midst of this chaos the only calm voice of direction is a super-intelligent AI called MUSE which had been created to over-see the facility's operations but had, until this point, been long deactivated for again some unknown reason; until the robotic experiment arrives and turns him back on. Between his help and guidance, and the robot's ability to actually move about the facility, the two go on a mission to discover what had happened during their absence and hopefully to find their creator. This game contains a variety of levels, enemies, "friends?", bosses, weapons, and even equipable armors to keep the gameplay interesting as well as a somewhat decent story to get involved in.
results.name: HereAfter

results.deck: An indie real-time strategy game developed in 2018 for numerous '80s MS-DOS based PCs, featuring support for a variety of video and audio devices and modes.
results.description:
Overview

Planet X3 is an indie sci-fi real-time strategy game developed and published by The 8-Bit Guy for numerous MS-DOS based PCs on December 2018. It can be bought direct from here.

The sequel to the 2017 game Planet X2, Planet X3 is a personal project of David Murray (the creator of the YouTube technology channel The 8-Bit Guy) and, among numerous updates to the game's style and gameplay, features support for older MS-DOS PCs of the 1980's. It was originally crowdfunded via Kickstarter and has four "making-of" videos found on his YouTube channel.

Supported Video Modes

Low-Res (4-Color) Tileset

  • CGA 4-Color (320x200)
  • CGA 2-Color Monochrome (640x200) - Uses dithering.
  • Hercules 2-Color Monochrome (720x350) - Added in later revisions. Uses dithering.
  • CGA 4-Color Greyscale (320x200) - Added in later revisions. Unsupported on earlier CGA cards.

Medium-Res (16-Color) Tileset

  • CGA Composite 16-Color (160x200)
  • TGA 16-Color (160x200)
  • Plantronics Colorplus 16-Color (320x200) - Added in later revisions.

High-Res (256-Color) Tileset

  • VGA 256-Color (320x200)
  • TGA 16-Color (640x200) - Added in later revisions. Uses dithering. Unsupported on earlier TGA cards.
  • EGA 16-Color (640x200) - Added in later revisions. Uses dithering.
results.name: Planet X3

results.deck: A color-mixing Picross experience.
results.description:
Overview

Depixtion innovates on the popular Picross formula by integrating a never before seen color mixing mechanic, generating the largest color palette in a nonogram game to date Because of this, the player has a higher degree of artistic input on the final image, alongside a higher verticality of challenge from the puzzle itself. Developed & published by DevHour Games, Depixtion was released on Steam on July 17th, 2019.

Gameplay

Traditionally, Picross games consist of a single monochrome, grid based puzzle, typically ranging in sizes from 5x5 to 30x30 (and larger) that when solved using the number hints on the side and top of the grid, reveal a hidden image.

Depixtion enhances this core game play by blending in a color mixing mechanic. Instead of a single monochrome puzzle, players will complete 3 separate colored layers, that when complete, blend together, mixing the colors to create the final image.
results.name: Depixtion

results.deck: An arcade formula car racing game similar to the Pole Position series, featuring a unique ultra-wide three-monitor cabinet setup and branching paths (similar to Sega's later OutRun series).
results.description:
Overview

TX-1 is a third-person formula car racing game developed by Tazmi and released for arcades by both Tazmi (in Japan) and Atari (worldwide, in conjunction with both Namco for North America and Taito for Europe) in 1983.

A spiritual successor to Atari's Pole Position series, the game is known for its unique three-monitor ultra-wide cabinet setup and branching paths system (where players can choose between two roads at three points in the race, for a total of eight different courses).

Tazmi (under their original Tatsumi label) later made an updated version of the game in 1984, called TX-1 V.8, exclusive to Japan. They also used the three-monitor setup for Buggy Boy in 1985.
results.name: TX-1
